column2: RFK, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: I have used Replens for nearly 2 years until as of late noticed a painful burning sensation after use. In the begining it was fine. I was using it for menopausal dryness and wanted a drug estrogen free. It also caused small white balls of discharge which I attributed to the binding of vaginal skin cells. However the more I read on the ingredients I realized that this product was thining the mucous lining of the vagina making it more susceptible to infection. With the thining of the vaginal lining it was no longer a mystery about the burning. The manufacturer on their website claim they have done research which consists of 50 women, 12 of which dropped out for various reasons leaving only 38 in their study. Basically they could find no negative effects. Hardly a scientific study in my estimation. What about long term. This product contains Methylparaben,which can be a serious problem for skin disorders. Parabens can mimic estrogen. What are the long term effects of this drug. This drug I believe is harmful to women and should be recalled and more studies done. I would never recommend it or use it again and hope I did not sustain any injury from using it. I plan on bringing this to the attention of the FDA and encourage others who have had similiar experience to do so. People need to be informed so they can make good choices.

column2: unknown, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was happy  with it  until i started to have cramps like a period, then i started bleeding . I have stop using it.

Vaginal dryness loss of elasticity is Estrogen. Be careful you are not at any Breast Cancer risk first.

column2: goober, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: Suzie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Noticed pain and slight spotting after intercourse, this was last November. Advised to use Replens. Awful discharge and more spotting so returned to Doc. column9: replens has really helped me but now i have not been able to purchase it for the last few months and i can really tell the differance.

column2: deedee, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had a constantly worsening pain with intercourse over the last 14 years, it had gotton to the point that I was afraid to have sex with my husband.  I found out the problem I had was terrible dryness.  It burned and stung and was pain beyond discription.  Only another woman who has suffered from these symptoms could understand.    Thanks to the manufacturer who came up with this product.  I cannot express my relief, and you have probably saved my marriage.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking replens about 2 months ago, I had vaginal dryness to the point sex was extremly unconfortable.  After taking replens I had very little problem.  I havn't been able to find in the stores since I ran out.  I hope they don't discontinue this product.

column2: Lstnfnd55, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Suffered greatly for over 2 years with vaginal atrophy, did not want to use hormones. Pain was excruciating. This product (applied 2-3 times per week) has been a lifesaver! Discharge only lasted through first 3 applications. Dr. advised that the "clumps" and slightly  pink discharge were normal and they both disappeared as she said they would. I'm living life again. Unfortunately, it has become scarce on the shelves. I've purchased several hundred dollars worth to buy me some time, but manufacturer (Columbia) has done away with it. Don't know what the future holds.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have suffered with vaginal dryness for over 15 years. This is the first over the counter  vaginal creme which I have tried and has produced positive results. All others caused irritation.

column2: MK, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: While Replens provided fluid to my vagina, I found within the week that I had developed vaginitis, a rare occurence for me.  I got that treated, stopped using Replens, and have not had a recurrence of vaginitis.

column2: carol, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been suffering with stinging pain on intercourse for some time, which has ruined our sex life.  I finally realised it was simply due to vaginal dryness after coming off HRT a few years ago. A friend recommended Replens and the information on the pack suggested it was just what I needed.  I am sensitive to some chemicals in toiletries and am very careful not to use skincare products with petrochemical based ingredients.  Having looked up the ingredients of Replens, I was a little concerned about using something in my vagina that I would not normally choose to use on my face, and I find that even KY jelly stings, but was desperate to solve the sex problem and thought "if so many women use it, it must be OK".  First use, I experienced stinging - but I had sort of expected that, but felt much moister.  Second use last night - woke up with stinging and burning abdominal pain, this morning still stinging and cramping pains like a period.  Just like a waterworks infection that the extra moisture is meant to prevent!  Was worried I had another infection so checked online for adverse reactions, while most reported a discharge (which the product info warns you about, so I was expecting it) I was "reassured" to read that others had the burning and cramping as well.  I won't be using it again - trying natural progesterone and other more natural products instead.

column2: jane, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am surprised at all of the negative reviews. Perhaps those of us with a good experience don't generally check the reviews. I am 53 and have had serious vaginal dryness for several years. After five weeks of regular use, I am now juicy as a teenager! I follow package directions carefully: I use it every three days, and wait 12+ hours before having intercourse, by which time the creme is absorbed (the package says to wait at least two hours, but I can see that the creme might still be hanging around in that timeframe). Yes, I had significant cell sluffing in the first two weeks, and it was not a pleasant sight. While it was going on, I just fully inserted and removed three tampons in a row and they pulled out everything that was loose. At this point I am not noticing any more sluffing or discharge out of the ordinary. In any case, I'll take a few unsightly dead cells in exchange for leaving the lubricants in the drawer. I highly recommend this product.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: my dotor said this is one of the better product on the market. NOT... I have used it 3 times. I have the same type of discharge others have reported with no change in how dry I am. Would not recommend. Avoid this product due to the side effects.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: First time seemed to work well. Tried it again two weeks later - within two hours I was drier than usual and inside were white, pea-sized lumps, consistency of cottage cheese. They were still there the next morning, when I used a warm-water douche to wash them out. I do NOT believe they were "dead skin cells", as the Replens website suggests - I believe this was the product itself.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month

column2: mrsangry, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: I had the same experience with the discharge very much like cottage cheese.  My doctor says there is a binding agent in this product.  If you have yeast problems it will bind the cells.  Because of this, I did not get any lubrication relief.  I do not like this product.

column2: puddin, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: will this drug clump up because of body temp. from hot flashes and clump up, almost when having intercourse it looks like a yeast infection.

column2: Daisy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: My paps were inconclusive until I started using replens several nights a week, yes there is a discharge the next day, no problem, like I had before menopause. Dryness is gone and now my pap tests are normal. the shedding of accumalated cells is what your periods do and Replens replaces this process after Menopause. Result, no more dryness.

column2: katayoun, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Replens causes yeast infections!  I suspected the Replens was causing the infection, but my gynecologist said that couldn't be true. Fortunately, my dryness problem isn't bothering me any more, so I don't miss the Replens at all!!  DON'T USE THIS STUFF!!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I developed a yeast infection immediately after using this product. column2: jkdavis, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have used Replens 3 times. All 3 times I had the cottage cheese like discharge, each time it seems to have gotten worse. Last night I had BURNING, itching and lots of gross discharge while having intercourse! I got online to check to see if these were the side effects of using Replens. I have severe yeast problems as well as very dry skin now that I am perimenopausal. I certainly do not need anything that is going to cause even more problems for me! I am very disappointed that Replens does not have these side effects listed on the box nor on the instruction sheet!  I had to go online to find out that others have also had these side effects.
